main_definition: To systematically collect data or information by asking people a series of questions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A method to gather opinions from a group of people, usually through questioning.
meanings_and_examples.example: The research team conducted a survey to understand customer satisfaction with their new product.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An assessment or evaluation performed by examining a large number of cases or examples.
meanings_and_examples.example: Before launching the product, they carried out an extensive market survey on similar products in the industry.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To inspect or observe something thoroughly to gain information about it.
meanings_and_examples.example: The city council decided to conduct a street survey to assess the condition of infrastructure and public amenities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A document containing a series of questions intended to gather statistical data on various topics.
meanings_and_examples.example: She filled out an online survey about her shopping habits for market research purposes.
